answers.answer: Hi, you should consult Neurologist. Do you get some vision problems too? These kind of symptoms although vague but could be related to multiple sclerosis, diabetes, TIA etc. Are you hypertensive? Another possibility is vitamin B deficiency, peripheral blood smear along with serum vitamin B levels will prove to be helpful.Please get your blood glucose and blood pressure checked. MRI brain will help to pin point brain pathology, if any.

Hi, thanks for your comment. Iam waiting on an appointment, which takes 6 months and thats going private. I have focus problems along with kind of a foogy vision. My surrounds dont seem to be right like iam in a dream state. I will ask my doctor about what you just stated. That day in the lab a fellow student said she smelt something burning and two other students said they felt all light headed and sleepy.Thanks again.

question: Hi Dr, 5 months ago i was in a chemical lab about to start work on a Gas Chromatography Mass spec when i fell extremely ill. I am still unwell and have being to a number of GPs and Consultants and Mental health clinic, but with no answers. I am waiting on an appointment to see a neurologist. My symtoms are as follows, dizzness, slightly disorianted, vomiting (the first few weeks), difficulties in breathing, spaced out feeling, foggy brain, my preception of my surroundings has not being the same since that day, its like iam in a dream state. I also have concentration problems, tingling in hands and feet, slight numness in my head. In the first few weeks i have flu like symtoms. I am still suffuring from FATIGUE and weekness all the time even after a good night sleep. I also have had aggresive taughts.Do you think my symtoms are related to the chemical lab or is it related to something else?I hope you can help me on this matter, like advice on who should i see in the medical department.RegardsKen
title: Dear Dr
